EndingBefore.description: Return the page of results immediately before this cursor
EndingBefore.name: ending_before

Limit.description: Number of results to return per page

PackageUrl.description: A URI-encoded Package URL (purl). Supported purl types are apk, cargo, cocoapods, composer, deb, gem, generic, golang, hex, maven, npm, nuget, pub, pypi, rpm, and swift. A version for the package is also required.
PackageUrl.name: purl

StartingAfter.description: Return the page of results immediately after this cursor
StartingAfter.name: starting_after

Version.description: The requested version of the endpoint to process the request
Version.name: version

204.description: The operation completed successfully with no content

400.description: Bad Request: A parameter provided as a part of the request was invalid.

401.description: Unauthorized: the request requires an authentication token.

403.description: Forbidden: the request requires an authentication token with more or different permissions.

404.description: Not Found: The resource being operated on could not be found.

409.description: Conflict: The requested operation conflicts with the current state of the resource in some way.

500.description: Internal Server Error: An error was encountered while attempting to process the request.

AccessTokenTtlSeconds.description: The access token time to live for your app, in seconds. It only affects the newly generated access tokens, existing access token will  continue to have their previous time to live as expiration.

AppName.description: New name of the app to display to users during authorization flow.

ClientId.description: The oauth2 client id for the app.

ClientSecret.description: The oauth2 client secret for the app. This is the only time this secret will be returned, store it securely and don’t lose it.

description.description: A description of the issue in Markdown format
description.example:
## Overview


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to XML External Entity (XXE) Injection.

effective_severity_level.description: The type from enumeration of the issue’s severity level. This is usually set from the issue’s producer, but can be overridden by policies.

severities.description: The severity level of the vulnerability: ‘low’, ‘medium’, ‘high’ or ‘critical’.

title.description: A human-readable title for this issue.

updated_at.description: When the vulnerability information was last modified.

id.description: The Snyk ID of the vulnerability.

type.description: The type of the REST resource. Always ‘issue’.

Context.description: Allow installing the app to a org/group or to a user, default tenant.

representation.description: The affected versions of this vulnerability.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The request was missing these required fields: ...

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

ErrorLink.description: A link that leads to further details about this particular occurrance of the problem.

GrantType.description: An authorization grant is a credential representing the resource owner's authorization (to access its protected resources) used by the client to obtain an access token.

id.description: ID

InheritFromParent.description: Which parent to inherit settings from.

IsActive.description: Current status of the project settings.

IsConfidential.description: A boolean to indicate if an app is confidential or not as per the OAuth2 RFC.

IsEnabled.description: Whether the custom rules feature is enabled or not.

IsPublic.description: A boolean to indicate if an app is publicly available or not.

version.description: Version of the JSON API specification this server supports.

oneOf.description: A string containing the link’s URL.

href.description: A string containing the link’s URL.

custom_rules.description: The Infrastructure as Code custom rules settings for an org.

custom_rules.description: The Infrastructure as Code custom rules settings for an org.

parents.description: Contains all parents the org can inherit settings from.

group.description: The Infrastructure as Code settings at the group level.

id.description: ID

email.description: The email address of the invitee.

is_active.description: The active status of the invitation. is_active of true indicates that the invitation is still waiting to be accepted. Invitations are considered inactive when accepted or revoked.

role.description: The role assigned to the invitee on acceptance.

namespace.description: A name prefix, such as a maven group id or docker image owner

version.description: The version of the package

disclosed_at.description: When this problem was disclosed to the public.

discovered_at.description: When this problem was first discovered.

updated_at.description: When this problem was last updated.

url.description: An optional URL for this problem.

target_project_name.description: The target file name for the project.

RedirectUris.description: List of allowed redirect URIs to call back after authentication.

RedirectUrisNoMin.description: List of allowed redirect URIs to call back after authentication.

description.description: A markdown-formatted optional description of this remedy.
description.example: Upgrade the package version to 5.3.0 to fix this vulnerability

upgrade_package.description: A minimum version to upgrade to in order to remedy the issue.

type.description: The type of the remedy. Always ‘indeterminate’.

Scopes.description: The scopes this app is allowed to request during authorization.

score.description: The CVSSv3 value of the vulnerability.

source.description: The source of this severity. The value must be the id of a referenced problem or class, in which case that problem or class is the source of this issue. If source is omitted, this severity is sourced internally in the Snyk application.

vector.description: The CVSSv3 value of the vulnerability.

SeverityThreshold.description: Minimum Snyk issue severity to send a notification for, messages will not be sent for any issue below this value

disclosure_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was disclosed.

exploit.description: The exploit maturity. Value of ‘No Data’, ‘Not Defined’, ‘Unproven’, ‘Proof of Concept’, ‘Functional’ or ‘High’.

publication_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was published.

title.description: Descriptor for an external reference to the issue

url.description: URL for an external reference to the issue
